comment: He was very snarky in every email that he wrote to the class. I took Computer Applications with him. He opened assignments at Monday at 8pm and closed them at Thursday at 6pm. Then he complained that 3/18 of the class turned assignments in on time. He also made the online class pay for a very expensive textbook, but not the in person class.

Cannot get to the point: weekly module contains paragraphs you have to sort through to find important information. 
Limits creativity. majority of projects revolve around comicy styles, which he is interested in,forces you to create in those styles.
Impossible to work on your own time. doesnt open the module until monday NIGHT

Okay I guess??? Assignments weren't that hard, but he has weird due dates and horrible grading turn around time. Grades are due tomorrow and I still have stuff ungraded from March. Just super difficult, why is he even still here.

Incredibly tedious assignments with little time to complete. You will have major assignments due on Thursday at 6pm in a discussion post, replies to other students discussion post by 9pm Saturday, and then something due Sunday. No regard for a students well being or time. Absolute nightmare of a class. Also has a no late work policy but grades late

There are no appropriate tags for this professor but he is by far the worse professor/teacher I've had. His course is unorganized, grades come back late, feedback comes back late,  and has no consideration for your time or the fact it's an online course.(He will want you to print on campus). KSU needs to replace him. The other professors are great.

Not that bad of a course, pretty cool projects. My things are that he grades and gives feedback very late. Would have been helpful to know what I need to change before a final work. Also $50 for a textbook you will literally only use twice is crazy.

He has good feedback when it comes to discussion posts, but he grades very late. Also the assignment due dates are so weird and it's just a lot of work to keep up with. He also makes you pay $50 for a textbook you only use once.

Weekly "progress" discussions usually require the entire project completed a week in advance just to receive feedback for final adjustments. He sends passive-aggressive emails about professionalism but only graded our FIRST project YESTERDAY. Lots of "sketch 12 ideas" busy work too, but still probably the best prof you'll get for this course.

Taking prof. Smith's class online and asynchronous was not so bad. Most due dates were clear, though he was extremely late to give graded feedback. Video tutorials were definitely preferable to IRL demonstrations for me. Textbook was very expensive and used only twice. He gave some helpful feedback in discussion posts.

Beware, do not take this professor if you can avoid it! Very disorganized, gives rude feedback to students publicly in class, has no clear due dates, constantly changes due dates, and never updates the calendar. He expects everyone to be on the same level and pace and goes on tangents for an hour and finally demos at the last 30 mins of class.

One of the most pickiest art professors I've ever gotten. He took a lot points off because my project did not  include specific directions which WAS NOT IN THE ORIGINAL DIRECTIONS. And his directions are never clear. Don't waste your time with this professor.

By far one of the worst professors that I have taken, his course is extremely disorganized and he refuses to do anything about it. Everything in this course can easily be self-taught all under an hour through YouTube, he is also incredibly disrespectful towards students in his announcements and replies to discussions. Avoid taking this professor.

Do not take this professor if you want to actually learn anything about computer applications in art. Not only was his due dates confusing, his announcements copy and pasted (from last semester!), his criteria inconsistent, his feedback was negligible, and his expectations ridiculous, he also spoke rudely to students on multiple occasions.

His class is horribly disorganized online. MANY unclear due dates, NO course calendar on syllabus, you are going strictly off of D2L calendar. He also has multiple drop boxes for the same project, so if you put it in the wrong one you get a zero, (which is non-negotiable). DO NOT take his class online. PERIOD.

Whatever you do, do NOT take this professor online. I was constantly confused because he doesn't make his teaching specific to online classes, just copies and pastes stuff from his in-person classes. Many announcements from in-person classes and past semesters that make do dates confusing. He also tends to be rude when giving feedback.

grades based on attendance not based on actual effort put in/quality of the work. not a bad professor just very disorganized and rambles endlessly. also for some reason requires poster board for an applications class?? this is coming from someone who made an A.

Disorganized, behind on grading, slow to give feedback. Random schedule and due dates, with many conflicting dates being given, from past semesters that he copy/pasted without checking, then refuses to fix it. Announcements are cluttered mix of random (often wrong) due dates, adverts for Tubi TV, getting snippy with students, and critical info.
He is very particular.

His class is a disorganized mess. His due dates are set to the spring semester instead of fall and criticized students when it was pointed out (did not fix it). Rambles every class about unrelated topics. Everything is themed around comic books (his passion). He doesn't even know the programs well enough to be teaching them. Rushed my critiques.

Professor Mark is very attentive and patient especially with newer students. If you are confused with anything he is always open to help. If you're already familiar with Adobe programs, it's not a very difficult class but it definitely helps with creativity. He also has pre-recorded tutorials in case you need step-by-step help outside class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Tries to keep lectures short but informative. I loved his projects as they were more creativity driven rather than just copying something. Gives good critique without absolutely obliterating your confidence. Overall a great guy to talk to, even asked my class for critique of his own professional work!

Professor Mark is an all-around great professor. He makes our requirements very clear, and we have a lot of time to work in class, with a small number of projects. He's understanding and is always there to help with anything you need. He does ramble a bit, but you can tell he cares and wants you to succeed.

Good dude, he wants his students to succeed, however he has the tendency to ramble which makes paying attention pretty tedious during two hour software walkthroughs. I pretty much did work for other classes while passively paying attention and managed to get a B with youtube's help. Don't let late work accumulate and his class is an easy A.

This Professor was exceptional. All projects can be redone at the end of the semester for a better grade for the final project which is a portfolio. This was an all-online class so he would show you how to do each project on photoshop or illustrator, definitely learned a lot from him. Textbook was only used once for a hw assignment.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Rude and unorganized, expects students to attend LIVE zooms in an asynchronous class, months behind on grading, and conflicting instructions/due dates on every project. Had to guess what methods and dates he actually meant. Also used $80 book once. Did not respond to emails timely if at all. This was the worst online course/professor I had at KSU.
He is amazing and I learned so much! He truly cares. Do your work and you will easily get an A while also learning a lot. I loved his class!

I absolutely love this professor! I loved everything about his class and learned a lot. We only used the text book once but it was for a cool homework assignment. He is happy to teach animation and other programs while the class has lab time. I just love it! Amazing professor!! He is hilarious. If you are sick or have any problems, he understands!

I don't know how he was rated 1 star. He is the best professor at KSU. He cares a lot and is willing to teach you other programs. He works as an animator and knows what he's talking about. He does check points to look at your art and to talk about what to change and what isn't working. I love his classes!

DO NOT TAKE HIM! He rarely responds to emails and if he does, it's after the assignment was due. He is very disorganized; he tends to change the dates at the last minute leaving a day or so before the next project is due. He grades slowly with no rubric. He is rude as well and just overall a bad professor. A stressful class during a stressful time.
